briefTitle: Hydromorphone vs Fentanyl in Children Undergoing Tonsillectomy Surgery
officialTitle: A Randomized Controlled Trial to Compare Hydromorphone vs Fentanyl in Children Undergoing Tonsillectomy Surgery

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Children ages 2 to 15 years old
2. Presenting for tonsillectomy or adenotonsillectomy surgery
3. American Society of Anesthesiologists Physical Status (ASAPS) Classification 1, 2 or 3
4. Provide Informed Consent / Assent (as appropriate)

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Additional Concurrent surgeries, exclusive of myringotomy tubes, minor oral/nasal procedures (e.g. frenulectomy), and endoscopic procedures
2. Revision tonsillectomy or revision adenotonsillectomy surgery
3. Known pregnancy
4. Any condition which would make the participant, in the opinion of the investigator or the attending anesthesiologist caring for the patient, unsuitable for the study.

primary.measure: Number of Patients Requiring Rescue Intravenous Opioid

secondary.description: Revised Face, Legs, Activity, Cry, Consolability (rFLACC) Scale Each of the five categories (F) Face; (L) Legs; (A) Activity; (C) Cry; (C) Consolability is scored from 0-2, which results in a total score between zero and ten. 0=no pain/relaxed, 10=distressed/in pain
secondary.timeFrame: Upon arrival and then every 5 minutes for 15 minutes. Then every 15 minutes until discharged from phase 1 of the PACU.
Upon arrival and then every 5 minutes for 15 minutes. Then every 15 minutes until discharged from phase 1 of the PACU.

secondary.measure: Respiratory and PONV Events in PACU
Respiratory and PONV Events at Home
secondary.description: Survey sent to parent by email postoperatively
